void ast_replace_sigchld (  void   ) 
 

Replace the SIGCHLD handler.

Normally, Asterisk has a SIGCHLD handler that is cleaning up all zombie processes from forking elsewhere in Asterisk. However, if you want to wait*() on the process to retrieve information about it's exit status, then this signal handler needs to be temporarily replaced.

Code that executes this function *must* call ast_unreplace_sigchld() after it is finished doing the wait*().

Definition at line 718 of file asterisk.c.

References ast_mutex_lock(), ast_mutex_unlock(), and null_sig_handler().

Referenced by ast_safe_system().

00719 {
00720    unsigned int level;
00721 
00722    ast_mutex_lock(&safe_system_lock);
00723    level = safe_system_level++;
00724 
00725    /* only replace the handler if it has not already been done */
00726    if (level == 0)
00727       safe_system_prev_handler = signal(SIGCHLD, null_sig_handler);
00728 
00729    ast_mutex_unlock(&safe_system_lock);
00730 }

01915                strncat(p, ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01916                break;
01917             case 't': /* time */
01918                memset(&tm, 0, sizeof(tm));
01919                time(&ts);
01920                if (localtime_r(&ts, &tm))
01921                   strftime(p, sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt), "%H:%M:%S", &tm);
01922                break;
01923             case '#': /* process console or remote? */
01924                if (!ast_opt_remote) 
01925                   strncat(p, "#", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01926                else
01927                   strncat(p, ">", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01928                break;
01929             case '%': /* literal % */
01930                strncat(p, "%", sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt) - 1);
01931                break;
01932             case '\0': /* % is last character - prevent bug */
01933                t--;
01934                break;
01935             }
01936             while (*p != '\0')
01937                p++;
01938             t++;
01939          } else {
01940             *p = *t;
01941             p++;
01942             t++;
01943          }
01944       }
01945       if (color_used) {
01946          /* Force colors back to normal at end */
01947          term_color_code(term_code, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_BLACK, sizeof(term_code));
01948          if (strlen(term_code) > sizeof(prompt) - strlen(prompt))
01949             strncat(prompt + sizeof(prompt) - strlen(term_code) - 1, term_code, strlen(term_code));
01950          else
01951             strncat(p, term_code, sizeof(term_code));
01952       }
01953    } else if (remotehostname)
01954       snprintf(prompt, sizeof(prompt), ASTERISK_PROMPT2, remotehostname);
01955    else
01956       snprintf(prompt, sizeof(prompt), ASTERISK_PROMPT);
01957 
01958    return(prompt);   
01959 }

00902          }
00903          tmp[res] = 0;
00904          ast_cli_command(con->fd, tmp);
00905       }
00906       if (fds[1].revents) {
00907          res = read(con->p[0], tmp, sizeof(tmp));
00908          if (res < 1) {
00909             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "read returned %d\n", res);
00910             break;
00911          }
00912          res = write(con->fd, tmp, res);
00913          if (res < 1)
00914             break;
00915       }
00916    }
00917    if (option_verbose > 2) 
00918       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Remote UNIX connection disconnected\n");
00919    close(con->fd);
00920    close(con->p[0]);
00921    close(con->p[1]);
00922    con->fd = -1;
00923    
00924    return NULL;
00925 }
